document_data.mainbody: '''Kali''' was a strange, terrible interloper [[deity|goddess]] of both creation and destruction from the [[Vedic pantheon]].
document_data.Description:
In her [[avatar]] form, Kali was a [[human]] woman whose body was of a dark skin tone, with voluptuous proportions and four arms. In her true form, these arms each ended in hands with sharp talons, her skin was black as the night, and she stood {{SI|20|ft|long=yes}} tall. Her face had three red eyes, was skeletal-like, and had two long fangs.

She typically wore very little clothing other than a skirt made of severed hands and a necklace of skulls around her neck.
document_data.Personality: Kali was known to be incredibly ruthless,
document_data.Abilities:
Kali was capable of shape-shifting at will. Most forms she took through this power inspired a great sense of ''[[fear]]'' in other creatures. Any mortal that kissed her avatar was completely ''[[Dominate person|dominated]]'' by Kali, no matter their strength of will, and would remain as such until her avatar was destroyed.

She was capable of creating living creatures from inanimate matter.
document_data.Combat: Kali typically fought with her clawed hands and a [[sword]]. Outside of direct combat, this goddess was known to engage in covert methods of eliminating her opponents, typically strangling them to death from behind with a knotted cord.
document_data.Realm:
[[File:Kali holy symbol.png|thumb|273px|''The holy symbol of Kali'']]
Kali presided over both the [[Layers of the Abyss#Layer 500: Unnamed|500{{th}}]] and [[Layers of the Abyss#Layer 643: Caverns of the Skull|643{{rd}} layers of the Abyss]]. The first was an unnamed layer full of jagged mountains, tropical jungles in which all vegetation was blood-red in hue, Within this layer lived [[assassin bug]]s, [[elephant]]s, [[giant centipede]]s, [[leucrotta]]s, various types of [[spider]]s, [[spirit naga]]s, [[su-monster]]s, [[volt]]s, [[will-o'-wisp]]s, several types of [[demon]]s (in particular [[nabassu]]), as well as a variety of molds and [[slime]]s.

Throughout the 500{{th}} layer were several deteriorating temples, overgrown with the red vegetation of the realm's jungles. Within each of these temples lived fifty [[human]] [[petitioner]] [[monk]]s, who in life had been [[assassin]]s, and three [[chaotic evil]] [[rakshasa]]s who acted as the senior monks. Outsiders who came upon these temples were welcomed inside and invited to join them in worship of Kali. Those who refused their invitation would be attacked.

Each of these temples contained a treasure trove of [[magical item]]s. These included ''[[potion of climbing|potions of climbing]]'', ''[[potion of healing|potions of extra-healing]]'', ''[[potion of invulnerability|potions of invulnerability]]'', ''[[scroll]]s of [[protection from illusions]]'', ''scrolls of [[Protection from plants, 10' radius|protection from plants]]'', ''scrolls of [[protection from poison]]'', and ''scrolls of [[protection from traps]]''. They also usually held a ''[[book of vile darkness]]'', a ''[[hat of disguise]]'', a ''[[necklace of strangulation]]'', a ''[[nine lives stealer]]'', a ''[[scarab of death]]'', and swords with a ''+2 [[item enchantment|enchantment]]''.

The other layer she resided over was known as the "Caverns of the Skull". They were a series of dark and gloomy, ever-changing caverns of black stone, full of musty air and lit by flickering torches. It was inhabited by [[petitioner]]s as well as [[eyewing]]s, [[fetch]], [[fireshadow]]s, and bloodthirsty [[xorn]]. The fanatical petitioners within this layer were trapped within a constant cycle of conflict with each other, fighting to the death and then being reborn to start the cycle anew. When not fighting among themselves, these petitioners chanted day and night, their words echoing through the caverns. Unlike her other layer, those who resided here would outright try to kill any traveler so that their blood could be offered to Kali on altars.

Of all the petitioners within this layer the most powerful were [[proxy|proxies]], who acted as guardians of the [[portal|gates]] out of her realm. Only by killing them could one activate one of these gates. Rumors alleged that these proxies were brutal murderers in life whose vile acts had managed to impress Kali.
document_data.History:
[[Gustofsen Eller]], a planar expert renowned in the [[Realms]], spent much of his life trying to curb the activities and worship of Kali after a group of her worshipers from another [[plane]] murdered his family. However, his efforts to hurt her were largely ineffective and went unnoticed by the goddess.

Around [[1357 DR]], Kali began receiving a series of dreams involving a grand and complex ritual, requiring thousands of worshipers participating in a ceremony over the course of a thousand years, that climaxed in her powers being vastly enhanced. Wanting to further witness these visions, but avoid leaving herself vulnerable, she slept within a black crypt beneath the middle of her layer's ocean of blood. While sleeping she would summon worshipers to sacrifice their souls in order to nourish her, with demon servitors snatching those who were reluctant to do so.

Two months following the start of this activity, Gustofsen mistook the lack of her activity on the [[Prime Material plane]] as evidence that his efforts had proven successful and he proclaimed to have killed the goddess. An adventuring party was soon assembled in order to accompany him to her layer of the Abyss to verify this claim.
document_data.Activities: Kali was known to devour her own children for sustenance
document_data.Relationships:
Other deities within the [[Vedic pantheon]] would readily accept her taking the role of leadership in battles without protest, for they knew her destructiveness was unmatched.

Her prowess in destruction was so great that it inspired fear in even the most horrid of demons and [[devil]]s.
document_data.Worshipers:
Kali's cult of worship was known as the Thagna. Its priestly vestments were black [[robe]]s. They typically fought with [[club]]s, knotted cords, and weapons that did not draw blood. Those who swore to protect the cult fought with an enraged state and were willing to sacrifice themselves so long as it meant that all who opposed her were slain in the process. Her priests had access to spells from the [[All sphere|all]], [[charm sphere|charm]], [[combat sphere|combat]], [[creation sphere|creation]], [[healing sphere|healing]], and [[necromantic sphere|necromantic]] [[sphere]]s. In particular the ''[[invisibility]]'' spell. They were also skilled at hiding in the shadows and moving silently, as if a [[ranger]].

The worship of this goddess required sacrifices of blood and on occasion the sacrifice of an entire human. She was typically worshiped by assassins, as well as prominent and well-respected members of society. The latter would often sneak out under the cover of night and strangle travelers to death with knotted cords in order to prove their devotion.

Beyond the [[Prime Material plane]], Kali was worshiped in the [[Domains of Dread]] in the domain of [[Sri Raji]].<ref> Besides mortals, some [[tanar'ri]] priests pledged themselves to Kali. And she was one of many death gods revered by the [[Dustmen]].
document_data.Rumors & Legends: Some believed that she was capable of killing creatures with merely a thought.
